Job Title: Business Analyst/Data Analyst / Springfield, IL (quarterly 2-3 Days onsite)
Description: Location: One to three trips to Springfield, IL for quarterly onsite meetings. Functional Description: The Business Analyst/Data Analyst will perform business and data analysis tasks daily. Functions will include analysis, planning, assisting in managing project deliverables, updating the project plan using Microsoft Project, coordinating between the technical team and the business users. This role will support analysis of two different data structures to support conversion and new data model development of a large-scale data warehouse using complex SQL. This includes providing direction for the solution, ensuring data quality, and support of the design, development, and implementation (DDI) of the project. Primary Responsibilities: Analysis of Medicaid enrollment, provider, and claims data, current business processes and systems, identify requirements for new processes and systems, identifying and documenting data anomalies and collaborate with cross functional teams for effective resolution.  Work with internal team and customer on business documentation and updates.  Facilitate meetings with user groups and document meeting minutes, action items, and decisions.  Support the DDI Project Manager, as needed, including maintaining the Microsoft Project Plan/Schedule for DDI project.  Develop professional presentations using Microsoft PowerPoint.  Assist with data quality testing and follow up with business and ETL and QA Team.  Share use cases to data analysts for profiling, review results and infer compliance to Medicaid / CMS processes and guidelines  Ability to juggle multiple priorities and ensure availability to questions and clarifications from data analysts  Positive attitude and willingness to jump in and help where needed Required Qualifications: 7+ years of healthcare business analysis experience supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and user acceptance testing of various systems  4+ years of experience in working with State Medicaid and CHIP agencies  5+ years of Basic understanding of CMS reporting requirements for Medicaid  Bachelor's degree or higher degree in business intelligence, analytics, computer science, engineering, or related field  Firm understanding of Fee for Service (FFS), Managed Care claim adjudication processes from eligibility and enrollment to claims processing to funding/finance  Knowledge of health insurance, Health Management Organizations (HMO) and managed care principles including Medicaid and Medicare  Experience working on a Medicaid Enterprise System DDI.  Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, SharePoint and MS PowerPoint.  Be a self-starter and able to thrive in an environment with little guidance  Strong time management and organizational skills  Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills  Experience with facilitating meetings  Effective organizational, analytical, time management, problem-solving, and multi-tasking skills, and habits; ability to complete assignments under tight deadlines with little/no direct supervision Preferred Qualifications: Experience working with PERM, T-MSIS, CMS Federal Reporting or similar projects  Experience with Teradata and SQL Assistant  Experience in Azure Data Factory, PowerBI and Snowflake  Knowledge of Quality of Care program  Knowledge of data integration, software enhancements/planning and agile methodologies  Experience with using Azure DevOps, JIRA and Visio

About CivicaCivica is a 501(c)(4) social welfare organization established in 2018 by health systems and philanthropies to reduce chronic generic drug shortages and related high prices in the United States. Civica is led by an experienced team of healthcare and pharmaceutical industry leaders.Today, more than 55 health systems have joined Civica. They represent over 1,500 hospitals and one-third of all U.S. hospital beds. Civica has also begun to supply the U.S. Department of Veteran's Affairs, the U.S. Department of Defense and the U.S. Strategic National Stockpile of essential medicines.Civica recently announced plans to expand its mission, via a unit called CivicaScript, to into the outpatient pharmacy space and to manufacture and distribute insulins that, once approved, will be available to people with diabetes at significantly lower prices than insulins currently on the market. The availability of Civica's affordable insulins, beginning in 2024, will benefit people with diabetes who have been forced to choose between life sustaining medicines and living expenses, particularly those uninsured or underinsured who often pay the most out of pocket for their medications.Civica's mission is to ensure that quality generic medications are accessible and affordable to everyone. Since established, the #1 Policy for the Civica team has been "Do What Is in the Best Interest of Patients." Civica's manufacturing facility in Petersburg, Virginia, is the future home of affordable insulin and essential sterile injectable medicines. The facility is currently in late-stage construction and hiring for the site is well-underway.To find out more about how Civica's innovative model is directly impacting patient care, click here to read a summary from the New England Journal of Medicine. (https://catalyst.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/CAT.21.0189)To learn more about Civica's plans to bring affordable insulin to Americans living with diabetes, click here to read an article in BioSpace.(https://www.biospace.com/article/civica-is-rallying-leaders-to-make-insulin-affordable-by-2024-/)Position SummaryLooking for a dynamic, top performer who can consistently produce a high volume of quality and timely data models and Tableau visualizations. Draw upon a full range of Tableau features to design, develop, enhance, and support visualizations including, but not limited to highly interactive dashboards, scorecards, and reports. Ability to develop optimized data models using SQL. Repeated and demonstrated success in continuous improvement efforts. Company located in Lehi, UT and Petersburg, VA but remote/virtual work is an option.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesTABLEAU - Design, maintain and automate business visualizations/dashboards/KPIs in Tableau using advanced SQL. Follow company standards in dashboard development. At a minimum, you must have a demonstrated track record of professional (not only academic) experience with such things as Writing Custom SQL (not GUI), LOD, Parameters, Data Sources, Actions, Row Based Security and Table Calculations. Must have proven track-record of high-level execution in a fast-paced environment, delivering quality, insightful dashboards on-time and in-spec.SQL - Use SQL to pull data from enterprise data warehouse (EDW) to develop data models that follow standards. You must have a demonstrated track record of professional (not only academic) skills including such things as: Partitioning, Aggregating, CTEs, Optimization and Automating Data Reconciliation. You must be able to quickly troubleshoot and develop accurate data models using SSOT tables and effectively and promptly conduct peer SQL reviews.COMMUNICATION - Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing for required customer support, requirements gathering, validation and training. CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT - Contribute to the continuous improvement of the overall data infrastructure. You must have demonstrated experience of identifying, implementing, and measuring ways data and visualizations can be more accurate, trustworthy, and timely. Perform other duties as required.Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities)2+ years full-time, professional (not only academic) experience with Tableau and structured query language (SQL) - requirement.3-5 years of technical business analytic experience - requirement.Ability to execute a high-volume of on-time and in-spec projects in a rapidly changing environment - requirement.Extreme attention to detail and data accuracy - requirement.Bachelor's degree in analytics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, business, or related field. Bckground in finance or accounting or experience in managing financial and accounting data desired.Strong interpersonal and communication skills.Ability to balance multiple tasks simultaneously.PandoLogic. Keywords: Data Analyst, Location: PETERSBURG, VA - 23803

This is a remote position.Mid-Level Staff Product Data Analyst (2-3 year experience, remote)Be part of our future! This job posting builds our talent pool for potential future openings. We'll compare your skills and experience against both current and future needs. If there's a match, we'll contact you directly. No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from US/Canada residents during the application process. Hiring Type: Full-Time Base Salary: $90K-$100K Per Annum.As a Staff Product Data Analyst, you play a vital role in creating and refining advanced churn and LTV models by leveraging a wide variety of data sources. You will work hand-in-hand with multiple business departments to develop complex models and effectively communicate their business impacts, maintaining a leadership position in efficiency, quality, and other key metrics identified by you and pertinent stakeholders.This pivotal role falls under the Data Platform organization and you will report directly to the Head of Data Platform. Moreover, Financial Planning &and strategy Data Engineering, and cross-functional business teams will be the key to unlocking their potential through the strategic use of data and be the last mile for translation to impact on business.Responsibilities:An exceptional storyteller through dashboards and oral presentations to effectively communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders across all organizational levels. Collaborate closely with product owners and marketing teams to analyze the value of new features, enhancements, and projects as well as provide insights and hypotheses that will lead to experiment design in efforts of growth, retention, and expansion Based on exploratory analysis, create customer profiles, and develop metrics such as LTV and Churn based on these profiles Build out scalable data models that serve as the single source of truth for the growth product teams to be leveraged across the organization Analyze and recommend improvements to website performance by examining customer experience, conversion effectiveness, abandonment points, customer demographics, and website usability trends. Experimentation Evangelist - educate and promote a data-driven culture through experimentation Requirements:7+ years of experience in a highly analytical role, with at least 5+ years in a product analytics/data science role, preferably in a Product Led Growth organization with a focus on growth OR master or Ph.D. degree with 3+ years of demonstrated experience in a product led growth organization with a focus on growth optimization Advanced proficiency in SQL and A/B testing, as well as an understanding of data warehouse principles including data modeling; Experience in product-led growth A/B experiments involves understanding product metrics, formulating hypotheses, designing and implementing tests, analyzing results, and optimizing based on findings to drive key metrics like activation, retention, and revenue. Proficiency in utilizing scalable packages/libraries for experimentation, power analysis, in-depth statistical analysis, causal inferencing, and visualization in R or Python. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and prioritize growth opportunities based on data and experiment results Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to distill complex analytical solutions into actionable insights and communicate business impact to non-technical audiences A demonstrated self-starter with excellent prioritization skills, able to drive projects to completion with minimal guidance. Benefits:A fast-paced and collaborative environment Learning and development allowance Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage Flexible PTO policy Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

We are seeking a seasoned Data Engineer to join our dynamic Global Fulfillment team. In this role, you'll play a pivotal part in constructing enterprise data streams, assimilating data from various sources, and provisioning data as raw data streams and canonical business events. Our goal is to integrate Fulfillment data sources into our federated enterprise data, and as a Data Engineer, you'll spearhead this initiative. Additionally, you'll continuously identify opportunities for automation, reduce technical debt, and streamline manual data manipulations to enhance efficiency and optimize data delivery. Collaboration with cross-functional teams will be key, as you'll assess data hydration solutions, provide recommendations on automation opportunities, and ensure scalability of delivered frameworks.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field5 to 10 years of experience in data engineeringProficiency in SQL, with a focus on performance fine-tuning and building ETL pipelinesStrong understanding of modern data platforms such as Snowflake and DatabricksExperience Assembling Large, Complex Datasets To Meet Business RequirementsProficiency in scripting languages like Python and familiarity with devops CI/CD pipelinesWorking knowledge of cloud-based systems, preferably AWSAbility to troubleshoot technical issues in ambiguous environmentsDesired QualificationsExperience with cloud-based systems (AWS/Azure/GC) and Snowflake data warehousesExpertise in designing data structures, reports, and queriesFamiliarity with CI/CD processes and building data integrity checksExperience with Kafka technologies and real-time analyticsFamiliarity with Microservices architecture and large volume data handlingEntrepreneurial spirit with a focus on innovationExcellent communication skills with a collaborative mindsetPreferred ToolsDatabricks, Snowflake, Apache Airflow, Microsoft Azure Data Factory, Kafka, Power BI, SSASA Day In The LifeCoordinate with multiple data source teams to publish data to our Finance Data WarehouseWork closely with stakeholders to address data-related issuesBuild scalable data pipelines for machine learning deliverablesMentor junior resources and drive end-to-end engineering solutionsTranslate business issues into technical termsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to produce optimal solutionsAnticipate system challenges and propose solutionsParticipate in design and code reviews to ensure quality and testabilityWe are looking for individuals who are adaptable, self-learners, and passionate about leveraging data to drive business success. If you embody these qualities and are excited about joining our team, we'd love to hear from you.Employment Type: Full-Time

Overview Berkshire Hathaway GUARD Insurance Companies  is looking for a SQL developer.  We are looking to fill this position in our Wilkes-Barre, PA, Philadelphia, PA or Parsippany, NJ Offices. Berkshire Hathaway GUARD offers a collaborative company culture with outstanding benefits and competitive compensation. Our organization is hiring and we’re looking for talented individuals to join our team and establish a rewarding career with us.Our success is founded on our strong reputation, and we have received an A+ “Superior” grade by the leading independent insurance rating organization. Backed by our ultimate parent company, Berkshire Hathaway Inc., our brand is founded upon trust, service, and innovation. If you’re looking for an employer with integrity and flexibility, keep reading to learn about our benefits and job openings.Benefits Work life balance schedule- No Nights or Weekends!  Hybrid work schedule: Three days in the office, two days from home  Generous vacation and sick time  Closed on all major holidays  Healthcare benefits begin on your first day of employment  401K with company match and profit sharing  Every 5 years employees receive a generous monetary award to be used toward a vacation!  Tuition reimbursement after six months of employment  Discover opportunities to advance your career  Be part of Berkshire Hathaway Inc., one of the world’s most admired companies ResponsibilitiesModify existing software to correct errors or to improve its performance. Design, develop and modify software systems to improve efficiency and accuracy of reporting. Collaborate with systems analysts, programmers and others to design system enhancements and to obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces. Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design. Must feel comfortable working in a dynamic and flexible environment with changing requirements in a business casual environment  Development of high quality database solutions  Develop, implement and optimize stored procedures and functions using T-SQL  Review and interpret statistical reporting requirements  Research required data  Analyze existing SQL queries for performance improvements  Develop and maintain technical documentation, including data dictionaries, database schemas, flow diagrams, etc.  All other duties as assigned Qualifications Highly proficient in T-SQL or comparable relational database development skills  Experience with a modern object-oriented language such as C# or Java  Basic knowledge of software version control systems, preferably Git  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Strong technical and problem-solving skills  Ability to adapt to changing priorities in an Agile environment  A bachelor's degree with a strong academic record or equivalent work experience  1+ years experience with software development lifecycle to include designing, coding, testing and supporting web and database applications Preferred Experience in ISO (Insurance Services Office) statistical reporting  Experience in WCSTAT (Workers Compensation Statistical Reporting Specifications) reporting  Knowledge of Financial/Insurance Reporting Systems  Experience developing .NET web applications using C# and MVC  Front-end development experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery
